title: Good western cuisine on the island
text: Located in the old Georgetown area, Emily's steak house serves good authentic western cuisine and a slightly higher price range. However, you get premium food in return.

title: Fun Walk Up The Steepest Street In The World!
text:
We have great fun walking up the steepest street in the world. We took lots of photos
with the steep gradient as a background.
place: Baldwin Street: The Steepest Street in the World

title: Back again!
text: Located just across the Dunedin Railway station, awards-winning Ironic Cafe serves fantastic and delicious cuisines at reasonable prices. Service is also excellent. It is great to be back again!

title: This place is certainly worth a visit!
text: Easy access to a unique geographical feature formed over millions of years ago by sea water activity. Definitely a place to visit!

title: Visit to Tasman Arch, Devil's Kitchen & Tasman Blowhole
text: The three tourist sites are within walking distance of each other. The Tasman Arch and Devil's Kitchen are marvellous sculptures of Mother Nature! The blow-hole was a disappointment as the waves were not as strong during our visit.

title: Great Food at Reasonable Price
text: A great restaurant to try authentic Chinese cuisine. The dishes we had were very delicious and the price reasonable. Will return to this restaurant if I return to Hobart!

title: Good Vietnamese Cuisine
text: You can't go wrong with Saigon District, delicious Vietnamese cuisine and fantastic service. Quite a big restaurant with nice decor.

title: Interesting "Banquet" Menu
text: Service was good. We tried the Taj's banquet menu - 4 appetisers, 5 mains, a dessert and massala tea. Interesting menu with beef, vegetables, prawns and a lot of other spicy Indian dishes. Quite delicious.

title: Overrated
text: We tried the dishes at Fresh Noodles as they were highly recommended. No doubt the noodles were hand-made and delicious but the beef soup that we had were somewhat "diluted". Other dishes were okay.

title: Didn't get to view the "Pink Lake"
text: We went to the Westgate Park to view the Pink Lake. A bit of a disappointment as the lake was not pink n colour. So, it is just an ordinary park with two lakes. Apparently, the pinkishness comes during very hot weather when the sun's rays reacts with the algae and salt water. Perhaps another time.

title: Idyllic Stay at a Miniature Pony Farm
text: This place is about 45 minutes from Hobart, you will need your own transport. Facilities are top notch; jacuzzi, fireplace, literally everything. A nice farm with fruit trees, animals ... and a nice couple who runs the place. There's even a lake you can go boating and it has a resident platypus. The town Franklin is about a km away. Fantastic place for a break!

title: Aegean Airlines OK; Santorini Airport Overcrowded!!
text:
Aegean Airlines was quite okay although there was a delay.
We suspect it is due to the overcrowded and tiny Santorini Airport,
a nightmare. There is hardly any place to sit at the airport.

title: Smooth flight on Singapore Airlines
text: Smooth flight, good food and meals onboard, excellent service by cabin crew. No delays in departures!

title: Interesting Hike Up Vitosha
text: We took the Free Hiking Tour from Sofia which was excellent. You get to see the famous Boyana Church and Boyana Falls along the way. About four hours up and down - nearly 1,300 metres!

title: The Main Pedestrian Street of Sofia
text: This is a must-visit place to shop, eat and "experience" Sofia. Beautiful boulevard with a good selection of restaurants, boutiques, cafes, ice cream parlours ...

title: Stefan, Founder of Modern Bulgaria
text: A "haunting" statue of Stefan Stambolov at Krystal Park. Make sure you find out the story of this famous Bulgarian with the split head! The park is well-located near lots of other attractions and food joints.

title: A Great View of Skopje
text: The Millennium Cross at Vodno Mountain gives visitors an excellent view of Skopje. Things can be better improved, such as providing toilet facilities and a more efficient cable car service. A restaurant or coffee shop would be most welcome !

title: The Place to be in Skopje
text: The Stone Bridge is the place to be, especially in the evening. Besides being a historical bridge, there are lots of interesting places in the vicinity : the quaint old town, rows of cafes and restaurants, the pedestrian street, Mother Theresa's building, more than a hundred statues, including Alexander the Great and the old fort nearby.

title: Lovely Lake Matka
text: Less than 45 minutes from Skopje and you get to visit a lovely and tranquil place with some of the deepest caves in the world. You can kayak or take a boat trip, worth a half day trip. The restaurant by the lake serves good food at reasonable prices.

title: Quaint Old Bazaar, Skopje
text: After viewing the famous Alkexander the Great Statue, you should take a short walk to the old bazaar, a place steeped in history. Different lanes have different specialties and skills. A host of nice restaurants await too!

title: Plovdiv, European Cultural Capital 2019
text: Plovdiv is one of the oldest cities in Europe and the old town is filled with history at every turn. Visit the place first before it becomes too touristy!

title: Fantastic Tour
text: Our guide for the Plovdiv 365 Tours was fantastic - friendly, lively and very knowledgeable. We got a good understanding of Bulgarian history.

title: Historic Istanbul
text: Sultanahmet District is the place to stay and the place to visit. Full of historical monuments, buildings, safe and easy to move around. Also full of wonderful cafes and restaurants. Wow!

title: Very Unique Underground Cistern
text: The Basilica Cistern is also a must-see tourist attraction in Istanbul. It is very near the Blue Mosque and Hagi Sophia. Mesmerizing!

title: A Must Visit Site in Istanbul
text: Make sure you don't go during prayer hours as it will be closed to visitors. It is Muslim architecture at its finest!

title: D Place to Visit at Night
text: This is the place to visit in the evening - the mosques and monuments are all brightly lit. Colourful fountain and vibrant nighlife.

title: Bosphorus Cruise
text: The Bosphorus Cruise in the evening was particularly interesting and scenic. The pace is good and Istanbul is magnificent at night. Only complaint is the difficulty in getting tickets.

title: Acropolis - Amazing Athens
text: Acropolis is a must-visit site in Athens. The Parthenon, in particular, is very impressive. The view from Acropolis overlooking Athens is fantastic.

title: Alexis made Athens alive!
text:
Alexis of ATS was a fantastic host as he fed us with all kinds of information to make our trip to Athens so wonderful. We covered
most of our itinerary and Alexis was very patient and kind. Took photos for us too!

title: Jewel in the Pearl of the Orient
text: This "jewel" in Penang is a must visit destination for nature lovers. Located atop the cool Penang Hill, it is a nice nature walk in a virgin forest with lots of flora and fauna to savour. Curtis Crest Treetop Walk along the way provides you with magnificent views. The journey up the hill by funicular train itself is an experience!

title: Chew Jetty - What was it like in Old Georgetown
text: The Chew Jetty is a good reflection of Old Georgetown. It was one of the earliest settlements for the migrant Chinese. Though a bit touristy now, the semblance of the settlement on stilts is very much alive.

title: Khoo Kongsi - a beautiful clan house in old Georgetown
text: You should visit this clan house on the last Saturday of each month at 6 pm where entrance to the clan house is free and there will be a programme of thrilling chinese cultural performances. The clan house will be specially lighted up for your viewing.

title: Delicious Laksalicious
text: Give the assam laksa or nyonya laksa a try - the thick fish broth with black shrimp paste and a concoction of herbs and vegetables is a must try for all Penang visitors!

title: A good taste and feel of Bali!
text: This is an authentic Balinese restaurant that serves wonderful Balinese cuisine. Must trys include the sate chicken (skewered) - it comes on a mini hot stove, bebek (duck dishes) and the beef rendang. Good service in a lovely Balinese atmosphere.

title: A Must Visit Site in Penang
text: Wonderful place to visit - the "entopia experience" is very special. Thousands of colourful butterflies and other insects.

title: Good outing at Escape
text: A good outing at an outdoor theme park where you can spend a good 3-5 hours trying out various physical challenges for yourself and with your friends.

title: Lovely Place To Visit Early In The Morning
text: Going up Penang Hill on the Funicular Train is the best thing to do in the early morning. You will get an excellent view of the island from the top amidst cool surroundings. The Habitat, an ecotourism is a good place for a nice tropical jungle walk with its rich fauna and flora. Don't miss the Curtis Crest Tree Top Walk! You can take a buggy to the site if you prefer less walking.

title: Beautiful Temple on a Hill.
text: It may be quite a climb for the elderly but this "white temple" is simply beautiful once you view it at the top of a small hill. Lots and lots of steps. View is lovely at the top too!

title: Longest Cafe in Penang!
text: Just the place to be for coffee and cake lovers. The cafe is the longest in Penang, it is a very long walk from one end to the other. Music and singing available in the late evening.

title: Very good Nyonya food in an authentic Baba and Nyonya setting!
text: If you haven't tried authentic Nyonya food, you can get very good nyonya cuisine in a rich Nyonya ambience. Can be a bit pricey though.

title: Excellent restaurant in the heart of the city.
text: It is an award winning restaurant with all kind of fusion food. tasty, flavourful and reasonably priced. What else could you ask for?

title: Excellent food in a wondrous setting!
text: The garden is beautiful, the restaurant is top-notch with a wondrous setting. Must try the "Trust the chef" menu". The restaurant is only 15 minutes from Dunedin on Portobello Road. Make sure you make a booking first!

title: The Jewel of Penang - A must visit destination
text: This huge Buddhist temple complex on a hill slope has so much to offer - supposedly over 10,000 images of Lord Buddha, pagodas, temples at different levels of the hill, a giant bronze statue of Kuan Yin, the Goddess of Mercy overlooking the island and spectacular views. The market area below is itself an attraction!

title: Very good seafood porridge or noodles
text: Ka Bee serves very good seafood porridge or noodles. Lots of excellent side dishes like mantis prawns etc.. at affordable prices.
place: Ka Bee Cafe - Fresh Seafood Noodles

title: Tasty Japanese Vegetarian Food!
text: Give vegans more variety and choice. Food is beautifully prepared and tasty! Highly recommended. Small and cozy restaurant.

title: A Must Visit When In Penang!
text: It is a treasure trove of Baba and Nyonya Culture (marriage of Chines and local Malay), unique to Penang, Melaka, Medan and Phuket only. This is probably the largest collection of such a culture in the world. Definitely a must visit tourist spot!

title: Saigon House Cuisine
text: Extensive menu with authentic Vietnamese Cuisine. Nice and cozy setting. Reasonable pricing. Worth coming back again.
